project: Blood Assassin - Four Phase Image Integration

phase_1.name: Character Dossier (DOCX)
problems: Images failed to embed - generated-images directory not found in expected path
Claude's container cannot directly access user's local filesystem (/Users/carlo/...) for binary files
Generated images were WebP format despite .png extension - python-docx doesn't support WebP
solutions: Created Python script (add_images_to_dossier.py) that user runs locally with direct filesystem access - SUCCESSFUL
Alternative workflow: User uploads files to chat → Claude processes in container → User downloads result
Image format detection using 'file' command, then PIL conversion from WebP to PNG before embedding
notes: First attempt completed at 12:48 PM but without images
Created standalone Python script for local execution - user confirmed it worked with all 12 images
Demonstrated container-based workflow with single image (Queen Lysandria portrait) at 8:20 PM
Two successful approaches: (1) Local script with filesystem access, (2) Upload/process/download workflow

phase_2.name: Story Pitch Deck (PPTX)
problems: Images were in WebP format despite .png extension - python-pptx doesn't support WebP
solutions: Converted images from WebP to PNG using PIL/Pillow before embedding in presentation
notes: Created 8-slide professional pitch deck with character portraits
Includes title, world overview, characters, stakes, themes, market positioning, series potential, and call to action
Successfully embedded Elara and Lysandria portraits on multiple slides

phase_3.name: Visual Story Bible (PDF)
problems: All 10 new images were in WebP format requiring conversion
solutions: Batch converted and resized all images using PIL/Pillow
Used ReportLab to create comprehensive multi-section PDF
notes: 12 major sections: World Overview, Prophecy, Characters, Locations, Factions, Magic, Timeline, Themes, Props, Visual Design, Key Scenes
Successfully embedded all 12 images throughout document
Includes table of contents, custom styling, and page numbers

phase_4.name: Interactive Character Gallery (HTML)
solutions: Embedded all 12 images as base64 directly in HTML for single-file portability
notes: Created responsive interactive gallery with 4 sections: Main Characters, Supporting Cast, Locations, Key Scenes
All 12 images embedded as base64 (12.51 MB total file size)
Single self-contained HTML file ready for web deployment

claude_filesystem_limitations.can_list: Filesystem tools can list directories on user's local filesystem
claude_filesystem_limitations.cannot_read_binary: Cannot read/copy large binary files (docx, images) from user's filesystem to container
claude_filesystem_limitations.solution: User uploads files to chat (/mnt/user-data/uploads/) OR user runs scripts locally

docx_workflow.image_format_issue: Generated images were WebP despite .png extension
docx_workflow.image_conversion: Use PIL/Pillow to convert WebP to PNG before embedding
